name: Nhal
appearance: Weathered hands like a shipwright’s, hair tied back with a blue cord, and a counting beadline at his wrist. His coat pockets always clink with small chimes.
character: Consensus-builder who counts votes like rivets; empathetic until the last bolt must be driven.
talents: remembers names, debts, and old favors
finds a middle plank on a shattered pier
reads a room by its silences
flaws: nagging back pain that shortens meetings
dreams: keep the city’s braid of power from fraying
move some oath-lanterns out of the Diadem to dilute Ledger leverage
one last festival night with blue lamps unshadowed by rumor
secrets: is quietly canvassing delegates to relocate oath-lanterns to ward shrines
his grown child runs a stall in the Night Bazaar; he protects the register from audits
keeps a locked box of contraband hearing-minutes from closed chambers
